intro: Metrosideros latifolia, commonly known as the broad-leaved pohutukawa, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It is a small evergreen tree or shrub that typically grows along coastal areas. The plant is characterized by its broad, leathery leaves and clusters of bright red flowers that bloom throughout the year. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal forests and scrublands. The species is also known for its rapid growth and ability to withstand salt spray and strong winds.
